titleInfo.title: Letter No 21 of 1822 from William Bruce, Resident at Bushire to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has resulted in a small hole in the fabric of the folio. This hole slightly obscures the addressed of the letter.

mods.abstract: The letter is enclosing a copy of the Resident's communication to the Governor General of the same date (see f 34v). It further updates the Bombay Government on the Resident's recent progress in raising funds at Bushire for the use of British forces at Bassidore [Bāsaʻīdū], and outlines the Resident's decision to maintain a sum of 50,000 rupees at Bushire so that future requests for funds may be more promptly attended to.
